title: 第一章 不要燒我！
content:
Scooping up a handful of water and splashing it on his face, Zhou Ze slowly lifted his head, looking at his reflection in the mirror, looking a bit haggard. As an emergency doctor, this haggardness was almost a standard feature.

"Dr. Zhou, a new patient is coming soon, seems to have fallen from a building, don't know if it's suicide!" Nurse Wang Ya called out from the men's restroom doorway.

"Got it, coming right away." Zhou Ze responded, then pulled out a tissue, wiped the water droplets clean, and started to walk out.

The ambulance quickly drove into the hospital. On the stretcher lay an old man in a gray Tang suit. The old man was coughing incessantly, and from time to time, blood foam and fragments of internal organs were coughed out. His entire body was stained with blood.

Zhou Ze immediately ran over, pushing the stretcher while observing the patient's condition, and at the same time shouted to those ahead, "Prepare surgical instruments, quickly!"

The patient's condition was very bad.

"I... I... don't want to die."

The old man opened his eyes, looking at Zhou Ze, who was closest to him.

"Don't worry, you'll be fine. We'll help you. You won't die."

Most critically ill patients say such things at this time. Only a minority can calmly face death. And as a doctor, it's certainly not the time to analyze the illness with the patient or tell them their chances of survival. What the patient needs at this moment is psychological comfort.

"No... no... down there... down there... down there is really too terrifying..."

The old man suddenly gripped Zhou Ze's wrist, looking at him with a serious expression.

"Calm yourself, relax. Your life will be fine." Although his wrist was hurting, Zhou Ze did not try to break free.

"I don't want... don't want to go down again... they... they found me... I... they found me..."

"Hiss..." Zhou Ze suddenly felt a sharp pain in his wrist.

"Dr. Zhou, your hand!" The young nurse beside him immediately cried out.

The old man's fingernails were very long, and for some unknown reason, they were black, a translucent black similar to amber, not like dirt was accumulated within them;

And at this moment, the old man's fingernails had already dug into Zhou Ze's wrist flesh.

"I won't go down... won't go down... won't go down... haha... cough cough cough..."

The old man suddenly straightened up and coughed violently. Immediately after, his body trembled, the hand gripping Zhou Ze slipped away, and he became still.

"Prepare for resuscitation!" Zhou Ze shouted.

The old man was pushed into the emergency room. Doctors and nurses began resuscitative measures, and the defibrillator was also ready.

"Dr. Zhou, let me treat your wound." Wang Ya came over at this moment.

As doctors, they weren't really worried about this minor injury. Their biggest concern was the possibility of the old man having other diseases, which could put the doctor in a dangerous situation of occupational exposure. After all, there was a lot of blood on the old man's hands just now, and no one knew if he had any infectious diseases.

Some illnesses, once contracted, could ruin a lifetime.

After the wound was bandaged, another doctor walked out of the emergency room and shook his head at Zhou Ze.

This meant the person could not be saved.

Everyone's spirits were a bit low, but for them, this kind of thing was already commonplace, and they would quickly adjust.

"Dr. Zhou, please get a check-up." Wang Ya suggested.

"No, I have something else tonight." Zhou Ze shook his head, walked directly to the changing room to change his clothes, then went to the hospital parking lot, got in his car, and drove away.

As soon as the car drove under the elevated section of Jianghai Avenue, Zhou Ze's phone rang.

"Hello, this is Zhou Ze."

"Dr. Zhou, the children are all waiting for you."

"I'm sorry, Principal Wu, a patient held me up. I'm on my way now. Please ask the children to wait for me a little longer."

"Alright, alright." The other end quickly hung up.

Zhou Ze checked the time again, it was already 8:30 PM. The children at the orphanage usually went to bed early.

The red light turned green, and Zhou Ze stepped on the accelerator, driving forward.

"Honk! Honk! Honk! Honk! Honk!"

And just then,

A heavy truck ran a red light and drove over. Zhou Ze only had time to turn his head and look out the car window at the blinding high beams,

Immediately after,

"Bang!"

The world spun,

The small car, like a fragile piece of white paper, was directly sent flying by the heavy truck, rolling several times in the air before crashing to the ground.

...

"Ugh..."

Zhou Ze woke up,

He found his body completely immobile, as if it were stuck.

At the same time, his eyes couldn't open. He knew he had been in a car accident, a very serious one. Out of professional habit, he really wanted to check his injuries now, but he couldn't move.

All around, he occasionally heard the sound of other vehicles driving by, and various honking sounds.

Am I still at the accident scene?

Am I still in the car?

Zhou Ze thought to himself.

Soon,

Police sirens came, and the sound of fire trucks,

Finally, the familiar sound of ambulance sirens reached Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze sensed his body being moved. The temperature nearby was a bit high; they were likely cutting open his car to rescue him.

Zhou Ze had participated in many such rescue operations and was familiar with some of the procedures.

What a pity, the cake in his back trunk and the Children's Day party for the orphanage kids would have to be canceled.

"Dr. Zhou!"

A familiar voice called out.

It must be Dr. Chen from the hospital.

Zhou Ze sighed in relief. At least, he had saved his life. This could be considered an unexpected disaster.

There were also voices of a few nurses nearby, but because it was too noisy, Zhou Ze couldn't hear clearly.

But then, Dr. Chen's next words made Zhou Ze's heart plummet!

"Dr. Zhou has lost his vital signs."

No,

I'm not dead!

I'm not dead yet!

I'm not dead!

Zhou Ze screamed desperately in his heart!

He wasn't dead, he was still conscious, he wasn't dead!

Next, Zhou Ze sensed someone performing CPR on him. He felt each heavy compression, yet he couldn't open his eyes or speak.

He wasn't dead.

He hoped they would quickly realize he wasn't dead!

But after a flurry of activity,

Zhou Ze heard the sound of several familiar nurses crying,

Dr. Chen punched the nearby car door, looking very distraught.

Hey!

Don't give up!

Please don't give up!

I'm not dead!

I should be in a state of suspended animation right now,

Excessive blood loss?

Severe injuries?

But I'm really not dead!

I should still be breathing, I should still have a heartbeat!

Zhou Ze roared wildly in his heart.

But then, he sensed himself being lifted onto a stretcher, likely being transported into an ambulance.

Immediately after, he heard the ambulance starting.

The nurses in the ambulance were still crying.

But their crying sounded particularly harsh to Zhou Ze's ears,

He wasn't dead.

Why are they crying!

Why cry!

Look at me again,

Look at me again,

Check again,

I'm not dead!

The ambulance stopped.

Immediately after, Zhou Ze heard the hospital leaders speaking:

"Little Zhou is just gone?"

"The car accident was very severe. Dr. Zhou was overly injured and suffered excessive blood loss. Death has been confirmed."

"Really? He's just gone like that?" Another deputy director still couldn't believe it.

"Little Zhou is gone." This was the voice of a department head. "I just checked again."

I'm not dead!

You quacks!

I'm not dead!

You bastards!

Bastards!

Zhou Ze cursed incessantly in his heart. At this moment, the people around him were no longer his colleagues, nor his friends, nor his leaders or elders,

They actually believed he was dead.

But could a dead person still hear and perceive?

I'm not dead!

You bastards,

You mongrels,

You sons of bitches!!!!!

Save me!

Save me!

The stretcher began to move. All around was quiet, and the temperature was gradually dropping.

"Xiao Ya, don't be too sad. The director said the hospital will hold a memorial service for Dr. Zhou tomorrow."

"Suqin Jie, I just can't believe it, someone just gone like that. Dr. Zhou was such a good person, how could he just be gone?"

"There's no telling what the day may bring. Just accept it."

After saying this, the two nurses left.

All around,

Empty,

That chilling coldness,

Was so clear.

Zhou Ze struggled incessantly, constantly trying to resist. He wanted to wake up, he desperately longed to make a sound.

But his current feeling was like sleep paralysis. No matter how hard he tried, his body simply wouldn't obey him.

Finally,

He gave up in despair,

He was tired,

And exhausted,

He knew where he was now,

In the hospital,

Morgue.

...

When Zhou Ze "woke up" again, he sensed a faint coolness on his face, and a sharp stinging sensation was also clear.

"Is the makeup done?" Someone asked nearby.

"Don't rush, just wait. He's been hit so badly, how can the makeup be done so quickly?"

"The hospital is already rushing us, they need to send him to the memorial service soon."

"Or you can do it."

The mortician seemed a bit annoyed, and applied the makeup with more force. Of course, their clients were dead people, who naturally wouldn't feel pain or complain. They just needed to show results to the living.

Zhou Ze no longer had the strength to struggle,

He simply lay there quietly,

Enduring the stinging sensation of the makeup brush pressing repeatedly on his face,

Finally,

The makeup was finished.

"Alright, tell them to come in. We're done with our work."

Zhou Ze felt himself being changed into clothes. Immediately after, he was pushed out, and the hospital orderlies lifted him into a soft, confined space.

This,

Must be a cold storage casket.

Then, all the surrounding noise was instantly cut off,

The lid must have been closed.

Shaking,

Swaying,

Bumping...

After an unknown period, Zhou Ze finally heard sounds again. The lid of the cold storage casket must have been opened.

What entered his ears,

Was funeral music.

The director was speaking into a microphone, praising him, lamenting his loss,

Then came the deputy director and the department head, and others.

Around,

Footsteps passed by from time to time,

Some simply walked quietly, taking a last look at him,

Some even tried to call out to him, with a choked voice,

This was the viewing of the remains.

Viewing,

My remains!

I'm not dead,

I'm really not dead,

I'm not dead yet!

Not dead!

Zhou Ze wailed in his heart,

He began to try again,

But still couldn't,

He could only hear and feel,

But couldn't speak,

Nor could he open his eyes,

Everyone thought he was dead,

But he himself knew,

He wasn't dead yet!

The children from the orphanage also came, crying by his side.

They cried sincerely, because Zhou Ze himself was a child who grew up in an orphanage. As a result, after he started working, most of his salary was donated to the orphanage. This car accident happened because he was rushing back to the orphanage that night to celebrate Children's Day with the children.

"Little Zhou, rest in peace. This time, you died in the line of duty. You have no family, but your compensation will be given to the orphanage, don't worry." The deputy director stood by Zhou Ze and said.

Subsequently,

Zhou Ze sensed himself being isolated again; the lid of the cold storage casket must have been closed once more.

Then came another period of bumping,

Finally, it stopped.

The lid of the cold storage casket was opened again,

All around, it was a bit quiet; occasionally, human voices were heard, but not in a noisy way.

Two people, one holding his shoulders and one holding his legs, lifted him up and placed him on another cold rack, which seemed to be made of steel.

These two people were very skilled, extremely skilled.

Around, there was a faint, indistinct sound of crying.

Zhou Ze at first couldn't tell where he had arrived,

But at this moment,

He suddenly understood,

Bastards!

They had sent him to the crematorium!

They were going to burn him!

I'm not dead, you bastards!

Damn your ancestors!

I'm not dead!

Not dead yet!

Don't cremate me,

Don't cremate me!

I'm really not dead yet!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

You beasts,

You mongrels,

You sons of bitches!!!!!

This time, Zhou Ze was the most frantic, the most insane he had ever been,

He knew,

Once he was cremated,

There would be no turning back!

He would face death directly!

A complete and utter end!

He was unwilling, he truly was unwilling. He was not yet thirty, he hadn't married, he didn't have children, he still had a life, he still had a long way to go!

"Mommy, I just saw this uncle's hand move." A little girl's timid voice sounded nearby.

"Slap!" A small slap landed.

"Don't talk nonsense, I'll deal with you when we get home." The girl's mother scolded.

Zhou Ze despaired,

Because no matter how much he struggled,

How much he roared in his heart,

The people outside couldn't sense it.

He was placed on the conveyor belt,

The machine started,

He was being pushed forward,

He knew what he was about to face,

And because of that, he was incredibly terrified!

No,

No,

No!

I'm not dead, I'm really not dead!

Don't burn me!

Don't burn me!

No one could hear his cries,

They were only responsible for being sad,

Only responsible for being upset,

Only responsible for completing this process,

Then going home for dinner, and continuing on tomorrow.

Finally,

Zhou Ze sensed that he seemed to have been pushed into a narrow place filled with the smell of oil dregs,

Immediately after,

A sticky liquid was sprayed onto his body,

He knew what this was,

It was gasoline,

Immediately after,

"Sizzle..."

Hot!

Very hot!

Pain,

Intense burning pain!

Fire,

Fire,

Big fire,

Fire everywhere...

title: 第三章 贅婿
content:
Midnight streets,

The streetlights yellow,
The people frantic,
The weather cold, with a wind like a knife cutting at one's skin.

Zhou Ze also felt cold.
He didn't know where he was,
But he knew one thing:
This was... the human world.

He had died, but he had returned.
He didn't know what he should do,
He could only mechanically and numbly keep walking forward.
He didn't have the time to think about too many other things right now,
Such as the place he had just been,
Such as the old man he had saved before his car accident,
Such as the faceless woman in the pond wearing a red dress,
Such as... his fingernails.

He had returned, which should have been a joyful thing, but even when people occasionally walked by, even if he tried his hardest to greet them, no one could see or hear him.
He was rejected and isolated by this world.

Those who haven't experienced being put in "solitary confinement" won't understand the pain of complete isolation. And for Zhou Ze, the entire world was his cage, and the cage was covered with a black cloth.

No one could see him,
Nor could anyone communicate with him,
He couldn't pick up any solid object,
Even,
The wind could easily blow right through him.
He was so frail,
The phrase "weak against the wind" was absolutely no exaggeration when applied to him.

Moreover, what shocked and horrified Zhou Ze the most was that
He could see faint specks of light constantly scattering from his body,
In other words,
His body was slowly fading.
Perhaps in another quarter of an hour, he would completely disappear, every last insignificant trace of him erased.

He didn't know how any of this happened, but he knew that his time was truly running out.

Among the Eight Immortals, Iron Crutch Li entered the body of a starved, collapsed person in the form of a soul, which is how he became known in later legends.
Zhou Ze had also heard stories about ghosts "possessing a body to return to life." He also wanted to possess a body to return to life. He was very cold and panicked. He needed a physical body to attach himself to.
He didn't even care whose body it was.

At times like these, people are always selfish, and Zhou Ze was no exception. Moreover, he truly couldn't take it anymore.

However, whenever he tried to approach someone, lights would appear above their head and on their shoulders, directly preventing him from getting close. He even got hurt as a result, accelerating his "evaporation."

He was a bit tired, and a bit numb,
He was waiting for his end,
Waiting for his finish.
As someone who had already died once, facing death again made him a bit more composed.
Furthermore, given Zhou Ze's current situation, the longer he lingered here, the longer he would suffer.

"Creak..."
Ahead, there was a storefront still lit up. It seemed to be a bookstore, as rows of bookshelves could be seen through the glass door.
Someone pushed the door open and came out. It was a man in a hoodie. The man wore a hat, so his face wasn't clear. He looked left and right for a while, then hurried away.
Of course, the man couldn't see Zhou Ze, who was standing less than five meters away from him.

Initially, Zhou Ze didn't feel anything unusual, but shortly after the man left, Zhou Ze suddenly sensed a warm aura from inside the bookstore.
Yes,
A warm aura.
This warmth made Zhou Ze feel somewhat bewildered, but he was like a person on the verge of freezing to death who suddenly got a box of matches. Even knowing the matches wouldn't save his life, he would still strike them to feel the last bit of warmth before dying.

Zhou Ze walked towards it, his body passing directly through the bookstore's glass door, continuing further inside, and arriving behind the bookshelves.
Behind the bookshelves,
Lay a person,
It was a handsome young man, probably twenty-three or twenty-four years old. Because the air conditioning was on in the store, he wasn't wearing many clothes, just a long-sleeved shirt and a light jacket.
He lay on the ground, but from him, Zhou Ze sensed a warm feeling, like a pauper walking on the road at night and picking up a bag of gold coins.
This attraction was irresistible, and at this moment, Zhou Ze had no right to refuse!

Zhou Ze walked over and crouched down in front of the young man.
He didn't know how to enter the other person's body, but he understood how to touch the warmth he needed.
He extended a hand and placed it on the other person's chest.
Zhou Ze saw his fingernails slowly embed into the other person's body.
This was a very strange sensation, different from the "breeze" blowing through his body when he walked on the street earlier. This was a kind of merging, a fusion using his fingernails as a medium.
Slowly, Zhou Ze himself began to enter the other person's body. The two began to overlap.

..................

"Xu Le! Wake up, wake up!"

Zhou Ze was awakened by a series of shoves. No, to be precise, he was "startled." He opened his eyes and found himself sitting behind the bookstore counter, where he had been resting his head on his hands.

"Hey, wake up!"
The woman's voice was sharp, high-pitched, and filled with an air of command.

Raising his head, Zhou Ze looked at the woman in front of him. No, to be precise, it should be a girl, probably high school age. Although she was a big girl, she still had a bit of childishness about her.

"Hey, Xu Le, what do you mean by this? You're getting bold, aren't you? Trying to give my parents and my sister attitude, aren't you? You actually dared not to come home all night!
Who gave you such guts!"

Xu Le?
Who was that?
Zhou Ze spread his hands in confusion, finding them smooth. His previous hands had some calluses from long hours of practicing surgical instruments, but these hands did not.

"Hey, I'm talking to you!"
The girl slammed a hand on the counter, full of aggression.

Zhou Ze frowned slightly, stood up, and walked to the glass mirror by the store door. He saw his reflection, an unfamiliar face. No, he had seen this face before, it was the face he saw last night.
This body,
Is mine now?

"Hey, what do you mean? My parents are angry, my mom is even throwing a fit at home. I'm telling you, everything you eat, drink, and use now belongs to my family. What right do you, a live-in son-in-law, have to put on airs in my house?
Who are you trying to put on a show for?!
If you dare not come home tonight again, believe it or not, I'll come over and smack you!"

The girl made to raise her hand, but she suddenly realized that the man in front of her, her "brother-in-law," didn't dodge or beg as usual. Instead, the meaning in his eyes made her feel somewhat afraid.
At this point, she checked the time and realized it was already 7:30.

"Hmph, I'm going to school now, I'll settle with you tonight!"
The girl stomped off, fuming.

Zhou Ze slowly sat back down in the chair behind the counter. There was an old laptop here, and next to it, a mobile phone.
Even now, he still hadn't adapted to his identity change.
He was Zhou Ze, a renowned young surgeon from Tongcheng, and he was an orphan.
Now,
He had become this person.
What did that girl just say?
He was... a live-in son-in-law?
Had a wife?
And a mother-in-law and father-in-law?
And judging by the attitude and tone of his "sister-in-law" when speaking to her "brother-in-law" just now, this "live-in son-in-law" truly conformed to ancient traditions.

A live-in son-in-law, commonly known as a "door-to-door son-in-law," was not only looked down upon by his wife's family but also by everyone around him in ancient times. Their status was even similar to criminals; during the Han and Tang dynasties, those forced into border garrisons often included赘婿 (a man who marries into his wife's family and lives with them).

He picked up the phone. It wasn't password-protected, whether out of laziness or fear, but it allowed Zhou Ze to easily open its WeChat and QQ.
The QQ contact list was sparse, just a few junior high, high school, and college classmates, and then a family list with only one person, labeled "Wife."
He opened the QQ chat history with her, it was empty.
Alright,
Zhou Ze opened WeChat, tried searching, and found the woman labeled "Wife." There were replies here, mostly Xu Le asking about things like what to eat tonight, what to prepare tonight, how much money was needed for stock, how much the bookstore had sold recently, how his health was, and a whole lot more.
The other person's replies were often perfunctory and aloof,
Like:
"Oh"
"Hmm"
"Okay"
To replace longer answers.

Zhou Ze tossed the phone aside. This social dynamic was a bit complicated. He suddenly looked at his palm. His fingernails were no different from anyone else's.
However, in the events leading up to his car accident—saving the old man, escaping from the faceless woman, entering this guy's body—his fingernails had played a crucial role.

With a thought,
At that moment,
Zhou Ze found his fingernails slowly growing longer, simultaneously becoming pitch-black and translucent. There was even a faint black mist swirling around them.

"Whew..."
He let out a long breath,
Closed his eyes,
And when he opened them again,
His fingernails had returned to normal.

From morning until noon, Zhou Ze sat there, trying to adapt to his new identity and calm the discomfort caused by the change. He didn't even eat lunch, whether he forgot or simply didn't feel hungry.
This was still Tongcheng. Zhou Ze's former home was in Chongchuan District, and now he was in Gangzha District, which wasn't far.

By the afternoon, Zhou Ze sighed, slowly stood up, and decided to make the best of it.
He started trying to clean the bookshelves, at least to give himself something to do.
The old man who had choked him before he died had said "he's been found," and the faceless woman in the underworld had said "you'll be caught sooner or later," which created a sense of crisis in Zhou Ze's mind.

His current state was "barely surviving." To die and be resurrected was an act of divine grace, so he cherished it. At least, until he fully understood the situation and gathered enough clues, he had to embrace this identity. It was best not to cause too much abnormality, not to attract the attention of those "who wanted to catch him."

The business at this shop was truly terrible. The slump in the traditional book market hadn't been a one or two-day affair, and this location wasn't on the prime commercial street at the entrance of a school.
One could only say that "Xu Le's" choice to open a bookstore here made it questionable whether he could even break even.

It wasn't until three o'clock in the afternoon that the first customer of the day walked in.
The customer browsed in the children's books section for a long time.
Zhou Ze waited for a while, then walked over and asked, "What kind of genre are you looking for?"
Although Zhou Ze himself didn't know much about it.

"Just looking around," the other person replied.
"Hmm." Zhou Ze didn't bother him anymore. He hadn't fully immersed himself in the role of "bookstore owner" yet.

But just then,
The other person suddenly walked behind him and said eerily,
"You really don't recognize me?"

"What?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Last night, I hit you on the head with a baseball bat and robbed you of your money.
And I even specifically checked,
You clearly had no breath left then."
